comment.author: 18169274@N07
comment._content:
Liminality (from the Latin word līmen, meaning "a threshold" [1]) is a psychological, neurological, or metaphysical subjective, conscious state of being on the "threshold" of or between two different existential planes, as defined in neurological psychology (a "liminal state") and in the anthropological theories of ritual by such writers as Arnold van Gennep, Victor Turner [2], and others.
DUH!!!
